text: {{Infobox writer | name = Kim Chi-ha | image = Kim Chi-ha.jpg | imagesize = | caption = Kim Chi-ha | pseudonym = | birth_date = | birth_place = Mokpo, Jeollanam-do, Chōsen, Japan | birth_name = Kim Yeongil | death_date = | death_place = Wonju, South Korea | resting_place = | occupation = Writer | nationality = | ethnicity = | period = 1963–2022 | genre = | subject = | movement = | language = Korean | spouse = | partner = | relatives = | children = | influences = | influenced = | website = }} Kim Jiha (; 4 February 1941 – 8 May 2022) was a South Korean pro-democracy activist, poet and playwright.LTI Korea Author Database: http://klti.or.kr/ke_04_03_011.do# He won the Lotus Prize for Literature in 1975. ==References== Category:1941 births Category:2022 deaths Category:South Korean writers Category:Korean poets Category:Playwrights Category:South Korean activists
title: Kim Chi-ha
